body: [GitMate.io](https://gitmate.io) thinks the contributor most likely able to help you is @nicoddemus.

I don't know so I dug around a little, it seems that deprecation was introduced in db6f347db6d3f2db5aa2cf2d27630db5ab99d589 with the introduction of `pytest_load_initial_conftests`, so I would recommend using that instead.

issue.title: Add param annotations and types to hookspec

repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

body: Definitely @Sup3rGeo, thanks for noticing. Opened #3417 for it.
Unfortunately `pytest_load_initial_conftests` doesn't work from inside `conftest.py`, so it's not an exact replacement.

this is tricky, I'm leaning on `pytest_cmdline_preparse` to inject the bazel [test target](https://bazel.build/reference/test-encyclopedia#:~:text=optional-,TEST_TARGET,-The%20name%20of) as a suffix to the `--log-file`.

When I make that modification in `pytest_cmdline_preparse` the value is reflected before the log is opened and I see the correct value reflected in the `pytest_report_header` I added to report the `--log-file` value https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/discussions/13635#discussioncomment-14024397.

When I pivot the implementation over to using `pytest_load_initial_conftests ` the ordering must be off or something because the `--log-file` value still assumes the value passed at the command line shell for the pytest invocation with the suffixing not taking effect.

noting for posterity, the actual deletion of the `pytest_cmdline_preparse` hook is found in this commit
https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/commit/f4e7b0d6e00aff21d1c4aadfb51fb0f1f4c4bd94#diff-3bcca5362f4ed2c327bb6e465f6f53d516b8bc5561d3ae72a1519666700511a3

This commit landed on Jan 2, 2024, and was released in pytest version 8.1.0
